movies.title: The Grand Bounce
movies.plot: A man writes a check for $1,000 to cover a gambling debt. The problem is that he doesn't have enough money in his bank account to cover it. The check was written on Friday afternoon, but cannot be cashed before the following Tuesday. The check is used to pay several debts until...
movies.simplePlot: A man writes a check for $1,000 to cover a gambling debt. The problem is that he doesn't have enough money in his bank account to cover it. The check was written on Friday afternoon, but ...

biography.bio: Barbara Bedford was born on July 19, 1903 in Eastman, Wisconsin, USA as Violet Rose. She was an actress, known for The Last of the Mohicans (1920), Tumbleweeds (1925) and Found Alive (1933). She was married to Terry Spencer, Alan Roscoe and Irvin Willat. She died on October 25, 1981 in Jacksonville, Florida, USA.
biography.name: Barbara Bedford

biography.bio: Margaret Bert was born on June 4, 1896 in Blackburn, Lancashire, England as Margaret Birtwistle. She was an actress, known for Vengeance Valley (1951), Kathleen (1941) and Sarge Goes to College (1947). She died on May 1, 1971 in Sacramento, California, USA.
biography.name: Margaret Bert

biography.bio: Dell Henderson was born on July 5, 1883 in St Thomas, Ontario, Canada as George Delbert Henderson. He was an actor and director, known for Show People (1928), The Crowd (1928) and The Genius (1914). He was married to Florence Lee. He died on December 2, 1956 in Hollywood, California, USA.
biography.name: Dell Henderson

biography.bio: Olaf Hytten was born on March 3, 1888 in Glasgow, Scotland. He was an actor, known for The Good Earth (1937), Sherlock Holmes and the Voice of Terror (1942) and The Ghost of Frankenstein (1942). He died on March 11, 1955 in Los Angeles, California, USA.
biography.name: Olaf Hytten

biography.bio: John Kelly was born on June 29, 1901 in Boston, Massachusetts, USA as John F. Kelly. He is known for his work on Bringing Up Baby (1938), Little Miss Marker (1934) and Black Friday (1940). He died on December 9, 1947 in Los Angeles, California, USA.
biography.name: John Kelly

biography.bio: Gayle Morris is an actress, known for The Grand Bounce (1937) and Bowery Boy (1940).
biography.name: Gayle Morris

biography.placeOfBirth: New York City, New York, USA
biography.bio: J. Carroll was born in New York City to Catherine Moran and Patrick Sarsfield Naish (not in the business). He was educated at St. Cecilia's Academy, New York City. He had seven years stage experience in Paris and New York. Later in stock company. First screen appearance in 1930. Fox brought him to Hollywood.
biography.name: J. Carrol Naish

biography.bio: Louis Natheaux was born on December 10, 1894 in Pine Bluff, Arkansas, USA as Louis F. Natho. He was an actor, known for Weary River (1929), Mexicali Rose (1929) and Four Walls (1928). He died on August 23, 1942 in Los Angeles, California, USA.
biography.name: Louis Natheaux

biography.bio: Evelyn Selbie was born on July 6, 1871 in Ohio, USA. She was an actress, known for When Liz Lets Loose (1917), A Woman's Way (1912) and The Daughter of the Sheriff (1913). She died on December 7, 1950 in Woodland Hills, Los Angeles, California, USA.
biography.name: Evelyn Selbie

biography.placeOfBirth: New York City, New York, USA
biography.bio: Born Peter Schmidt in New York City, Pete Smith got a job after graduating business college with The Player magazine and later with Billboard magazine. That led to his being hired as a publicist for Famous Players-Lasky and Artcraft Pictures, and he was later appointed publicity director at Paramount Pictures. Director Marshall Neilan hired Smith to be the publicist for his own production company, and Smith left New York for Hollywood. After Neilan's company closed, Smith freelanced for a short period before being hired by MGM in 1925 as the head of its publicity department, a position he held until 1930. The job that really brought him recognition, however, was his producing, writing and narrating a series of shorts known as "Pete Smith Specialties" for MGM. The one-reelers covered just about every subject imaginable, from the animal world to the latest technology to how to handle annoying patrons in movie theaters, all delivered with Smith's trademark wry, bemused narration. Many of the later shorts were written and directed by actor Dave O'Brien, using the name David Barclay. Sixteen entries in the series were nominated for Oscars, and two of them won. The series came to an end in 1954, though there were enough made to continue releasing into 1955. Smith's later years were plagued by bad health, and he spent more and more time being hospitalized. In 1979, with his health deteriorating rapidly, he committed suicide by jumping out of the window of his ninth-floor hospital room. He was 86 years old.
biography.name: Pete Smith

biography.bio: Harry Tenbrook was born on October 9, 1887 in Oslo, Norway as Henry Olaf Hansen. He was an actor, known for They Were Expendable (1945), Mister Roberts (1955) and The Long Voyage Home (1940). He died on September 14, 1960 in Woodland Hills, Los Angeles, California, USA.
biography.name: Harry Tenbrook

biography.bio: Emerson Treacy was born on September 7, 1900 in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA. He was an actor, known for Adam's Rib (1949), The Prowler (1951) and Sea Goin' Sheiks (1931). He was married to Ann McKay. He died on January 10, 1967 in Hollywood, California, USA.
biography.name: Emerson Treacy

biography.bio: Frank Whitbeck was born on July 17, 1882 in Rochester, New York, USA. He is known for his work on Forecast (1945), Battleground (1949) and Annie Get Your Gun (1950). He died on December 23, 1963 in Los Angeles, California, USA.
biography.name: Frank Whitbeck

filmingLocations.location: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer Studios - 10202 W. Washington Blvd., Culver City, California, USA
